results.title: Whales: Can they be saved?
results.creator_credit: Reid-Cowan Productions, Alan P. Sloan and Kenneth Post
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of species within the two major branches of the whale family: the baleen and the toothed whales. Describes their characteristics and behaviour. Because modern whaling is so efficient many whales are in danger of extinction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reid-Cowan Productions, Alan P. Sloan and Kenneth Post

results.title: Whales that wouldn't die
results.creator_credit: KPBS (Television station : San Diego, Calif.), Susan K Pollock and Frank Christopher
results.brief_description: Studies the characteristics, population density and habitats of the Grey Whale. Discusses the history of whaling, its particular effect on the Grey Whale, and the animal’s future prospects for survival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: KPBS (Television station : San Diego, Calif.), Susan K Pollock and Frank Christopher

results.title: Whales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Shows Jacques Costeau and his crew touring the sea in the last surviving wooden whaling boat, viewing an experiment with a whale at marine world in California and conducting a series of studies in the Indian Ocean.

results.title: Whales
results.brief_description: WHALES - a film as big, beautiful and complex as its subjects. Throughout history the destinies of men and whales have been closely linked. From primitive peoples, pitted against these mighty creatures with just a harpoon and cunning, whaling meant survival. In the 19th century whaling epitomised adventure, excitement and discovery. Today, whaling means big business, power and money. Now its the whales who excite our curiosity and demand our compassion. “Whales” is a thought-provoking look at our complex feelings of love, hate, necessity and fear towards the animals who share our planet as we struggle to balance our needs against their survival.

results.title: Whale Song Whales and Dolphins of the Pacific
results.brief_description: Whalesong is a tribute to the majesty and grace of singing, dancing, ancient mammals that have graced our planet for 50 million years … and yet are still endangered by senseless slaughter and ocean pollution. “Whalesong” will inspire awe, love and empathy for the whales and dolphins by allowing you to feel a part of their world. Lloyd Bridges is our escort and guide to the people that live in the sea.

results.title: Whale rider. Cracker bag
results.creator_credit: South Pacific Pictures, Apollo Media, Pandora Films, Outerspace, Ruby Films, Exit Films, Tim Sanders, John Barnett, Frank Hubner, Jane Liscombe, Niki Caro and Glendyn Ivin
results.brief_description: Whale Rider: Set in a small village in rural New Zealand, “Whale Rider” is the story of a Maori community who are looking for a new male heir as leader. All looks certain until the heir apparent and his mother die at childbirth leaving his twin, Pai, a baby girl. Pai (Keisha Castle-Hughes) has to overcome 1000 years of tradition and the fierce determination of her beloved grandfather to assert her rightful place as leader and re-unite her people. Beautiful landscapes, moody music and underwater photography add to the lush look of this film. Internationally acclaimed and multi-award winning feature film. Based on the novel “The Whale Rider” by Witi Ihmaera. “Cracker bag”: Personal childhood memories are evoked when watching this Australian short about a young girl, Eddie, as she saves her money to buy fireworks for Guy Fawkes Night. Set in the 1980s, “Cracker Bag” is a tender suburban study that finely depicts a disheartening pivotal moment in the life of a young girl. Photographic-like in its 35mm presentation, “Cracker bag” is deservedly Winner of the Palme D’Or (Short Film) Festival De Cannes 2003 and many other accolades. Written and directed by Glendyn Ivin, starring young Edith Cattell as Eddie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Pacific Pictures, Apollo Media, Pandora Films, Outerspace, Ruby Films, Exit Films, Tim Sanders, John Barnett, Frank Hubner, Jane Liscombe, Niki Caro and Glendyn Ivin

results.title: Whale hunting
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Raymont and Mosha Michael
results.brief_description: An interesting and informative journey with six Inuit hunters in their hunt of the Beluga whale near Frobisher Bay, N.W.T. We learn about the methods used in pursuing the whale and dividing the carcass.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Peter Raymont and Mosha Michael

results.title: Whale bait
results.brief_description: A whale’s strategy for dealing with fishing fleets and scientific research. The film makes a simple and effective statement on the struggle between man and nature.

results.title: Wet earth and warm people (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: Candid glimpses of Indonesia and its people, in and around the capital, Jakarta. Following where chance leads, the film captures the flavour of life in this fertile crescent of tropical islands as it focuses on the Indonesian people caught between the past and the conflicting options of the future - to change or not to change from long-established patterns of life to ones more influenced by western technology. Awards: Melbourne, Atlanta, San Francisco and Toronto.
